gurmukhi: ÃÄ siq nwmu krqw purKu inrBau inrvYru Akwl mUriq AjUnI sYBM gur pRswid ]
roman: ikOankaar sat naam karataa purakh nirabhau niravair akaal moorat ajoonee saibha(n) gur prasaadh ||
english: One Universal Creator God. The Name Is Truth. Creative Being Personified. No Fear. No Hatred. Image Of The Undying, Beyond Birth, Self-Existent. By Guru's Grace ~
Name of the Composition, "Jup". Chant And Meditate:
True In The Primal Beginning. True Throughout The Ages.

gurmukhi: hY BI scu nwnk hosI BI scu ]1]
roman: hai bhee sach naanak hosee bhee sach ||1||
english: True Here And Now. O Nanak, Forever And Ever True. ||1||

gurmukhi: socY soic n hoveI jy socI lK vwr ]
roman: sochai soch na hoviee je sochee lakh vaar ||
english: Even if one bathes hundreds of thousands of times, the mind does not become cleansed.

gurmukhi: cupY cup n hoveI jy lwie rhw ilv qwr ]
roman: chupai chup na hoviee je lai rahaa liv taar ||
english: By remaining silent, inner silence is not obtained, even by remaining lovingly absorbed deep within.

gurmukhi: BuiKAw BuK n auqrI jy bMnw purIAw Bwr ]
roman: bhukhiaa bhukh na utaree je ba(n)naa pureeaa bhaar ||
english: The hunger of the hungry is not appeased, even by piling up loads of worldly goods.

gurmukhi: shs isAwxpw lK hoih q iek n clY nwil ]
roman: sahas siaanapaa lakh hoh ta ik na chalai naal ||
english: Hundreds of thousands of clever tricks, but not even one of them will go along with you in the end.

gurmukhi: ikv sicAwrw hoeIAY ikv kUVY qutY pwil ]
roman: kiv sachiaaraa hoieeaai kiv kooRai tuTai paal ||
english: So how can you become truthful? And how can the veil of falsehood be torn away?

gurmukhi: hukim rjweI clxw nwnk iliKAw nwil ]1]
roman: hukam rajaiee chalanaa naanak likhiaa naal ||1||
english: O Nanak, it is written that you shall obey the Hukam of His Command, and walk in the Way of His Will. ||1||

gurmukhi: hukmI hovin Awkwr hukmu n kihAw jweI ]
roman: hukamee hovan aakaar hukam na kahiaa jaiee ||
english: By His Command, bodies are created; His Command cannot be described.

gurmukhi: hukmI hovin jIA hukim imlY vifAweI ]
roman: hukamee hovan jeea hukam milai vaddiaaiee ||
english: By His Command, souls come into being; by His Command, glory and greatness are obtained.

gurmukhi: hukmI auqmu nIcu hukim iliK duK suK pweIAih ]
roman: hukamee utam neech hukam likh dhukh sukh paie'eeh ||
english: By His Command, some are high and some are low; by His Written Command, pain and pleasure are obtained.

gurmukhi: ieknw hukmI bKsIs ieik hukmI sdw BvweIAih ]
roman: eikanaa hukamee bakhasees ik hukamee sadhaa bhavaie'eeh ||
english: Some, by His Command, are blessed and forgiven; others, by His Command, wander aimlessly forever.

gurmukhi: hukmY AMdir sBu ko bwhir hukm n koie ]
roman: hukamai a(n)dhar sabh ko baahar hukam na koi ||
english: Everyone is subject to His Command; no one is beyond His Command.

gurmukhi: nwnk hukmY jy buJY q haumY khY n koie ]2]
roman: naanak hukamai je bujhai ta haumai kahai na koi ||2||
english: O Nanak, one who understands His Command, does not speak in ego. ||2||

gurmukhi: gwvY ko qwxu hovY iksY qwxu ]
roman: gaavai ko taan hovai kisai taan ||
english: Some sing of His Power-who has that Power?
Some sing of His Gifts, and know His Sign and Insignia.
Some sing of His Glorious Virtues, Greatness and Beauty.
Some sing of knowledge obtained of Him, through difficult philosophical studies.

gurmukhi: gwvY ko swij kry qnu Kyh ]
roman: gaavai ko saaj kare tan kheh ||
english: Some sing that He fashions the body, and then again reduces it to dust.

gurmukhi: gwvY ko jIA lY iPir dyh ]
roman: gaavai ko jeea lai fir dheh ||
english: Some sing that He takes life away, and then again restores it.
Some sing that He seems so very far away.
Some sing that He watches over us, face to face, ever-present.
There is no shortage of those who preach and teach.

gurmukhi: kiQ kiQ kQI kotI koit koit ]
roman: kath kath kathee koTee koT koT ||
english: Millions upon millions offer millions of sermons and stories.
The Great Giver keeps on giving, while those who receive grow weary of receiving.
Throughout the ages, consumers consume.
The Commander, by His Command, leads us to walk on the Path.
O Nanak, He blossoms forth, Carefree and Untroubled. ||3||

gurmukhi: swcw swihbu swcu nwie BwiKAw Bwau Apwru ]
roman: saachaa saahib saach nai bhaakhiaa bhaau apaar ||
english: True is the Master, True is His Name-speak it with infinite love.

gurmukhi: AwKih mMgih dyih dyih dwiq kry dwqwru ]
roman: aakheh ma(n)geh dheh dheh dhaat kare dhaataar ||
english: People beg and pray, ""Give to us, give to us"", and the Great Giver gives His Gifts.

gurmukhi: Pyir ik AgY rKIAY ijqu idsY drbwru ]
roman: fer k agai rakheeaai jit dhisai dharabaar ||
english: So what offering can we place before Him, by which we might see the Darbaar of His Court?

gurmukhi: muhO ik bolxu bolIAY ijqu suix Dry ipAwru ]
roman: muhau k bolan boleeaai jit sun dhare piaar ||
english: What words can we speak to evoke His Love?

gurmukhi: AMimRq vylw scu nwau vifAweI vIcwru ]
roman: a(n)mirat velaa sach naau vaddiaaiee veechaar ||
english: In the Amrit Vaylaa, the ambrosial hours before dawn, chant the True Name, and contemplate His Glorious Greatness.

gurmukhi: krmI AwvY kpVw ndrI moKu duAwru ]
roman: karamee aavai kapaRaa nadharee mokh dhuaar ||
english: By the karma of past actions, the robe of this physical body is obtained. By His Grace, the Gate of Liberation is found.

gurmukhi: nwnk eyvY jwxIAY sBu Awpy sicAwru ]4]
roman: naanak evai jaaneeaai sabh aape sachiaar ||4||
english: O Nanak, know this well: the True One Himself is All. ||4||

gurmukhi: QwipAw n jwie kIqw n hoie ]
roman: thaapiaa na jai keetaa na hoi ||
english: He cannot be established, He cannot be created.
He Himself is Immaculate and Pure.
Those who serve Him are honored.
O Nanak, sing of the Lord, the Treasure of Excellence.
Sing, and listen, and let your mind be filled with love.

gurmukhi: duKu prhir suKu Gir lY jwie ]
roman: dhukh parahar sukh ghar lai jai ||
english: Your pain shall be sent far away, and peace shall come to your home.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK nwdM gurmuiK vydM gurmuiK rihAw smweI ]
roman: gurmukh naadha(n) gurmukh vedha(n) gurmukh rahiaa samaiee ||
english: The Guru's Word is the Sound-current of the Naad; the Guru's Word is the Wisdom of the Vedas; the Guru's Word is all-pervading.

gurmukhi: guru eIsru guru gorKu brmw guru pwrbqI mweI ]
roman: gur ieesar gur gorakh baramaa gur paarabatee maiee ||
english: The Guru is Shiva, the Guru is Vishnu and Brahma; the Guru is Paarvati and Lakhshmi.

gurmukhi: jy hau jwxw AwKw nwhI khxw kQnu n jweI ]
roman: je hau jaanaa aakhaa naahee kahanaa kathan na jaiee ||
english: Even knowing God, I cannot describe Him; He cannot be described in words.
The Guru has given me this one understanding:

gurmukhi: sBnw jIAw kw ieku dwqw so mY ivsir n jweI ]5]
roman: sabhanaa jeeaa kaa ik dhaataa so mai visar na jaiee ||5||
english: there is only the One, the Giver of all souls. May I never forget Him! ||5||

gurmukhi: qIriQ nwvw jy iqsu Bwvw ivxu Bwxy ik nwie krI ]
roman: teerath naavaa je tis bhaavaa vin bhaane k nai karee ||
english: If I am pleasing to Him, then that is my pilgrimage and cleansing bath. Without pleasing Him, what good are ritual cleansings?

gurmukhi: jyqI isriT aupweI vyKw ivxu krmw ik imlY leI ]
roman: jetee siraTh upaiee vekhaa vin karamaa k milai liee ||
english: I gaze upon all the created beings: without the karma of good actions, what are they given to receive?

gurmukhi: miq ivic rqn jvwhr mwixk jy iek gur kI isK suxI ]
roman: mat vich ratan javaahar maanik je ik gur kee sikh sunee ||
english: Within the mind are gems, jewels and rubies, if you listen to the Guru's Teachings, even once.
The Guru has given me this one understanding:

gurmukhi: sBnw jIAw kw ieku dwqw so mY ivsir n jweI ]6]
roman: sabhanaa jeeaa kaa ik dhaataa so mai visar na jaiee ||6||
english: there is only the One, the Giver of all souls. May I never forget Him! ||6||

gurmukhi: jy jug cwry Awrjw hor dsUxI hoie ]
roman: je jug chaare aarajaa hor dhasoonee hoi ||
english: Even if you could live throughout the four ages, or even ten times more,

gurmukhi: nvw KMfw ivic jwxIAY nwil clY sBu koie ]
roman: navaa kha(n)ddaa vich jaaneeaai naal chalai sabh koi ||
english: and even if you were known throughout the nine continents and followed by all,

gurmukhi: cMgw nwau rKwie kY jsu kIriq jig lyie ]
roman: cha(n)gaa naau rakhai kai jas keerat jag lei ||
english: with a good name and reputation, with praise and fame throughout the world-

gurmukhi: jy iqsu ndir n AwveI q vwq n puCY ky ]
roman: je tis nadhar na aaviee ta vaat na puchhai ke ||
english: still, if the Lord does not bless you with His Glance of Grace, then who cares? What is the use?

gurmukhi: kItw AMdir kItu kir dosI dosu Dry ]
roman: keeTaa a(n)dhar keeT kar dhosee dhos dhare ||
english: Among worms, you would be considered a lowly worm, and even contemptible sinners would hold you in contempt.

gurmukhi: nwnk inrguix guxu kry guxvMiqAw guxu dy ]
roman: naanak niragun gun kare gunava(n)tiaa gun dhe ||
english: O Nanak, God blesses the unworthy with virtue, and bestows virtue on the virtuous.

gurmukhi: qyhw koie n suJeI ij iqsu guxu koie kry ]7]
roman: tehaa koi na sujhiee j tis gun koi kare ||7||
english: No one can even imagine anyone who can bestow virtue upon Him. ||7||
Listening-the Siddhas, the spiritual teachers, the heroic warriors, the yogic masters.
Listening-the earth, its support and the Akaashic ethers.
Listening-the oceans, the lands of the world and the nether regions of the underworld.
Listening-Death cannot even touch you.
O Nanak, the devotees are forever in bliss.
Listening-pain and sin are erased. ||8||
Listening-Shiva, Brahma and Indra.
Listening-even foul-mouthed people praise Him.
Listening-the technology of Yoga and the secrets of the body.
Listening-the Shaastras, the Simritees and the Vedas.
O Nanak, the devotees are forever in bliss.
Listening-pain and sin are erased. ||9||
Listening-truth, contentment and spiritual wisdom.
Listening-take your cleansing bath at the sixty-eight places of pilgrimage.
Listening-reading and reciting, honor is obtained.
Listening-intuitively grasp the essence of meditation.
O Nanak, the devotees are forever in bliss.
Listening-pain and sin are erased. ||10||
Listening-dive deep into the ocean of virtue.
Listening-the Shaykhs, religious scholars, spiritual teachers and emperors.
Listening-even the blind find the Path.
Listening-the Unreachable comes within your grasp.
O Nanak, the devotees are forever in bliss.
Listening-pain and sin are erased. ||11||

gurmukhi: mMny kI giq khI n jwie ]
roman: ma(n)ne kee gat kahee na jai ||
english: The state of the faithful cannot be described.
One who tries to describe this shall regret the attempt.
No paper, no pen, no scribe
can record the state of the faithful.
Such is the Name of the Immaculate Lord.

gurmukhi: jy ko mMin jwxY min koie ]12]
roman: je ko ma(n)n jaanai man koi ||12||
english: Only one who has faith comes to know such a state of mind. ||12||
The faithful have intuitive awareness and intelligence.
The faithful know about all worlds and realms.
The faithful shall never be struck across the face.

gurmukhi: mMnY jm kY swiQ n jwie ]
roman: ma(n)nai jam kai saath na jai ||
english: The faithful do not have to go with the Messenger of Death.
Such is the Name of the Immaculate Lord.

gurmukhi: jy ko mMin jwxY min koie ]13]
roman: je ko ma(n)n jaanai man koi ||13||
english: Only one who has faith comes to know such a state of mind. ||13||
The path of the faithful shall never be blocked.
The faithful shall depart with honor and fame.
The faithful do not follow empty religious rituals.
The faithful are firmly bound to the Dharma.
Such is the Name of the Immaculate Lord.

gurmukhi: jy ko mMin jwxY min koie ]14]
roman: je ko ma(n)n jaanai man koi ||14||
english: Only one who has faith comes to know such a state of mind. ||14||
The faithful find the Door of Liberation.
The faithful uplift and redeem their family and relations.
The faithful are saved, and carried across with the Sikhs of the Guru.
The faithful, O Nanak, do not wander around begging.
Such is the Name of the Immaculate Lord.

gurmukhi: jy ko mMin jwxY min koie ]15]
roman: je ko ma(n)n jaanai man koi ||15||
english: Only one who has faith comes to know such a state of mind. ||15||
The chosen ones, the self-elect, are accepted and approved.
The chosen ones are honored in the Court of the Lord.
The chosen ones look beautiful in the courts of kings.
The chosen ones meditate single-mindedly on the Guru.
No matter how much anyone tries to explain and describe them,
the actions of the Creator cannot be counted.
The mythical bull is Dharma, the son of compassion;
this is what patiently holds the earth in its place.
One who understands this becomes truthful.
What a great load there is on the bull!
So many worlds beyond this world-so very many!

gurmukhi: iqs qy Bwru qlY kvxu joru ]
roman: tis te bhaar talai kavan jor ||
english: What power holds them, and supports their weight?
The names and the colors of the assorted species of beings
were all inscribed by the Ever-flowing Pen of God.
Who knows how to write this account?
Just imagine what a huge scroll it would take!
What power! What fascinating beauty!
And what gifts! Who can know their extent?
You created the vast expanse of the Universe with One Word!
Hundreds of thousands of rivers began to flow.
How can Your Creative Potency be described?
I cannot even once be a sacrifice to You.

gurmukhi: jo quDu BwvY sweI BlI kwr ]
roman: jo tudh bhaavai saiee bhalee kaar ||
english: Whatever pleases You is the only good done,
You, Eternal and Formless One! ||16||
Countless meditations, countless loves.
Countless worship services, countless austere disciplines.
Countless scriptures, and ritual recitations of the Vedas.
Countless Yogis, whose minds remain detached from the world.
Countless devotees contemplate the Wisdom and Virtues of the Lord.
Countless the holy, countless the givers.
Countless heroic spiritual warriors, who bear the brunt of the attack in battle (who with their mouths eat steel).
Countless silent sages, vibrating the String of His Love.
How can Your Creative Potency be described?
I cannot even once be a sacrifice to You.

gurmukhi: jo quDu BwvY sweI BlI kwr ]
roman: jo tudh bhaavai saiee bhalee kaar ||
english: Whatever pleases You is the only good done,
You, Eternal and Formless One. ||17||
Countless fools, blinded by ignorance.
Countless thieves and embezzlers.
Countless impose their will by force.
Countless cut-throats and ruthless killers.
Countless sinners who keep on sinning.
Countless liars, wandering lost in their lies.
Countless wretches, eating filth as their ration.
Countless slanderers, carrying the weight of their stupid mistakes on their heads.
Nanak describes the state of the lowly.
I cannot even once be a sacrifice to You.

gurmukhi: jo quDu BwvY sweI BlI kwr ]
roman: jo tudh bhaavai saiee bhalee kaar ||
english: Whatever pleases You is the only good done,
You, Eternal and Formless One. ||18||
Countless names, countless places.
Inaccessible, unapproachable, countless celestial realms.
Even to call them countless is to carry the weight on your head.
From the Word, comes the Naam; from the Word, comes Your Praise.
From the Word, comes spiritual wisdom, singing the Songs of Your Glory.
From the Word, come the written and spoken words and hymns.
From the Word, comes destiny, written on one's forehead.

gurmukhi: ijin eyih ilKy iqsu isir nwih ]
roman: jin eh likhe tis sir naeh ||
english: But the One who wrote these Words of Destiny-no words are written on His Forehead.
As He ordains, so do we receive.
The created universe is the manifestation of Your Name.
Without Your Name, there is no place at all.
How can I describe Your Creative Power?
I cannot even once be a sacrifice to You.

gurmukhi: jo quDu BwvY sweI BlI kwr ]
roman: jo tudh bhaavai saiee bhalee kaar ||
english: Whatever pleases You is the only good done,
You, Eternal and Formless One. ||19||
When the hands and the feet and the body are dirty,
water can wash away the dirt.
When the clothes are soiled and stained by urine,
soap can wash them clean.
But when the intellect is stained and polluted by sin,
it can only be cleansed by the Love of the Name.
Virtue and vice do not come by mere words;

gurmukhi: kir kir krxw iliK lY jwhu ]
roman: kar kar karanaa likh lai jaahu ||
english: actions repeated, over and over again, are engraved on the soul.
You shall harvest what you plant.
O Nanak, by the Hukam of God's Command, we come and go in reincarnation. ||20||
Pilgrimages, austere discipline, compassion and charity

gurmukhi: jy ko pwvY iql kw mwnu ]
roman: je ko paavai til kaa maan ||
english: these, by themselves, bring only an iota of merit.
Listening and believing with love and humility in your mind,
cleanse yourself with the Name, at the sacred shrine deep within.

gurmukhi: siB gux qyry mY nwhI koie ]
roman: sabh gun tere mai naahee koi ||
english: All virtues are Yours, Lord, I have none at all.

gurmukhi: ivxu gux kIqy Bgiq n hoie ]
roman: vin gun keete bhagat na hoi ||
english: Without virtue, there is no devotional worship.
I bow to the Lord of the World, to His Word, to Brahma the Creator.
He is Beautiful, True and Eternally Joyful.

gurmukhi: kvxu su vylw vKqu kvxu kvx iQiq kvxu vwru ]
roman: kavanu su velaa vakhat kavan kavan thit kavan vaar ||
english: What was that time, and what was that moment? What was that day, and what was that date?

gurmukhi: kvix is ruqI mwhu kvxu ijqu hoAw Awkwru ]
roman: kavan s rutee maahu kavan jit hoaa aakaar ||
english: What was that season, and what was that month, when the Universe was created?

gurmukhi: vyl n pweIAw pMfqI ij hovY lyKu purwxu ]
roman: vel na paieeaa pa(n)ddatee j hovai lekh puraan ||
english: The Pandits, the religious scholars, cannot find that time, even if it is written in the Puraanas.

gurmukhi: vKqu n pwieE kwdIAw ij ilKin lyKu kurwxu ]
roman: vakhat na paio kaadheeaa j likhan lekh kuraan ||
english: That time is not known to the Qazis, who study the Koran.

gurmukhi: iQiq vwru nw jogI jwxY ruiq mwhu nw koeI ]
roman: thit vaar naa jogee jaanai rut maahu naa koiee ||
english: The day and the date are not known to the Yogis, nor is the month or the season.

gurmukhi: jw krqw isrTI kau swjy Awpy jwxY soeI ]
roman: jaa karataa siraThee kau saaje aape jaanai soiee ||
english: The Creator who created this creation-only He Himself knows.

gurmukhi: ikv kir AwKw ikv swlwhI ikau vrnI ikv jwxw ]
roman: kiv kar aakhaa kiv saalaahee kiau varanee kiv jaanaa ||
english: How can we speak of Him? How can we praise Him? How can we describe Him? How can we know Him?

gurmukhi: nwnk AwKix sBu ko AwKY iek dU ieku isAwxw ]
roman: naanak aakhan sabh ko aakhai ik dhoo ik siaanaa ||
english: O Nanak, everyone speaks of Him, each one wiser than the rest.

gurmukhi: vfw swihbu vfI nweI kIqw jw kw hovY ]
roman: vaddaa saahib vaddee naiee keetaa jaa kaa hovai ||
english: Great is the Master, Great is His Name. Whatever happens is according to His Will.

gurmukhi: nwnk jy ko AwpO jwxY AgY gieAw n sohY ]21]
roman: naanak je ko aapau jaanai agai giaa na sohai ||21||
english: O Nanak, one who claims to know everything shall not be decorated in the world hereafter. ||21||
There are nether worlds beneath nether worlds, and hundreds of thousands of heavenly worlds above.

gurmukhi: EVk EVk Bwil Qky vyd khin iek vwq ]
roman: oRak oRak bhaal thake vedh kahan ik vaat ||
english: The Vedas say that you can search and search for them all, until you grow weary.

gurmukhi: shs ATwrh khin kqybw AsulU ieku Dwqu ]
roman: sahas aThaareh kahan katebaa asuloo ik dhaat ||
english: The scriptures say that there are 18,000 worlds, but in reality, there is only One Universe.

gurmukhi: lyKw hoie q ilKIAY lyKY hoie ivxwsu ]
roman: lekhaa hoi ta likheeaai lekhai hoi vinaas ||
english: If you try to write an account of this, you will surely finish yourself before you finish writing it.

gurmukhi: nwnk vfw AwKIAY Awpy jwxY Awpu ]22]
roman: naanak vaddaa aakheeaai aape jaanai aap ||22||
english: O Nanak, call Him Great! He Himself knows Himself. ||22||

gurmukhi: swlwhI swlwih eyqI suriq n pweIAw ]
roman: saalaahee saalaeh etee surat na paieeaa ||
english: The praisers praise the Lord, but they do not obtain intuitive understanding

gurmukhi: ndIAw AqY vwh pvih smuMid n jwxIAih ]
roman: nadheeaa atai vaeh paveh samu(n)dh na jaane'eeh ||
english: the streams and rivers flowing into the ocean do not know its vastness.

gurmukhi: smuMd swh sulqwn igrhw syqI mwlu Dnu ]
roman: samu(n)dh saeh sulataan girahaa setee maal dhan ||
english: Even kings and emperors, with mountains of property and oceans of wealth

gurmukhi: kIVI quil n hovnI jy iqsu mnhu n vIsrih ]23]
roman: keeRee tul na hovanee je tis manahu na veesareh ||23||
english: -these are not even equal to an ant, who does not forget God. ||23||

gurmukhi: AMqu n isPqI khix n AMqu ]
roman: a(n)t na sifatee kahan na a(n)t ||
english: Endless are His Praises, endless are those who speak them.

gurmukhi: AMqu n krxY dyix n AMqu ]
roman: a(n)t na karanai dhen na a(n)t ||
english: Endless are His Actions, endless are His Gifts.

gurmukhi: AMqu n vyKix suxix n AMqu ]
roman: a(n)t na vekhan sunan na a(n)t ||
english: Endless is His Vision, endless is His Hearing.

gurmukhi: AMqu n jwpY ikAw min mMqu ]
roman: a(n)t na jaapai kiaa man ma(n)t ||
english: His limits cannot be perceived. What is the Mystery of His Mind?
The limits of the created universe cannot be perceived.
Its limits here and beyond cannot be perceived.
Many struggle to know His limits,

gurmukhi: qw ky AMq n pwey jwih ]
roman: taa ke a(n)t na paae jaeh ||
english: but His limits cannot be found.
No one can know these limits.
The more you say about them, the more there still remains to be said.
Great is the Master, High is His Heavenly Home.
Highest of the High, above all is His Name.
Only one as Great and as High as God
can know His Lofty and Exalted State.
Only He Himself is that Great. He Himself knows Himself.
O Nanak, by His Glance of Grace, He bestows His Blessings. ||24||
His Blessings are so abundant that there can be no written account of them.
The Great Giver does not hold back anything.
There are so many great, heroic warriors begging at the Door of the Infinite Lord.
So many contemplate and dwell upon Him, that they cannot be counted.
So many waste away to death engaged in corruption.
So many take and take again, and then deny receiving.
So many foolish consumers keep on consuming.
So many endure distress, deprivation and constant abuse.
Even these are Your Gifts, O Great Giver!
Liberation from bondage comes only by Your Will.
No one else has any say in this.
If some fool should presume to say that he does,
he shall learn, and feel the effects of his folly.
He Himself knows, He Himself gives.
Few, very few are those who acknowledge this.
One who is blessed to sing the Praises of the Lord,
O Nanak, is the king of kings. ||25||
Priceless are His Virtues, Priceless are His Dealings.
Priceless are His Dealers, Priceless are His Treasures.
Priceless are those who come to Him, Priceless are those who buy from Him.
Priceless is Love for Him, Priceless is absorption into Him.
Priceless is the Divine Law of Dharma, Priceless is the Divine Court of Justice.
Priceless are the scales, priceless are the weights.
Priceless are His Blessings, Priceless is His Banner and Insignia.
Priceless is His Mercy, Priceless is His Royal Command.
Priceless, O Priceless beyond expression!
Speak of Him continually, and remain absorbed in His Love.
The Vedas and the Puraanas speak.
The scholars speak and lecture.
Brahma speaks, Indra speaks.
The Gopis and Krishna speak.
Shiva speaks, the Siddhas speak.
The many created Buddhas speak.
The demons speak, the demi-gods speak.

gurmukhi: AwKih suir nr muin jn syv ]
roman: aakheh sur nar mun jan sev ||
english: The spiritual warriors, the heavenly beings, the silent sages, the humble and serviceful speak.
Many speak and try to describe Him.

gurmukhi: kyqy kih kih auiT auiT jwih ]
roman: kete keh keh uTh uTh jaeh ||
english: Many have spoken of Him over and over again, and have then arisen and departed.
If He were to create as many again as there already are,

gurmukhi: qw AwiK n skih kyeI kyie ]
roman: taa aakh na sakeh keiee kei ||
english: even then, they could not describe Him.
He is as Great as He wishes to be.
O Nanak, the True Lord knows.
If anyone presumes to describe God,
he shall be known as the greatest fool of fools! ||26||

gurmukhi: so dru kyhw so Gru kyhw ijqu bih srb smwly ]
roman: so dhar kehaa so ghar kehaa jit beh sarab samaale ||
english: Where is that Gate, and where is that Dwelling, in which You sit and take care of all?

gurmukhi: vwjy nwd Anyk AsMKw kyqy vwvxhwry ]
roman: vaaje naadh anek asa(n)khaa kete vaavanahaare ||
english: The Sound-current of the Naad vibrates there, and countless musicians play on all sorts of instruments there.

gurmukhi: kyqy rwg prI isau khIAin kyqy gwvxhwry ]
roman: kete raag paree siau kaheean kete gaavanahaare ||
english: So many Ragas, so many musicians singing there.

gurmukhi: gwvih quhno pauxu pwxI bYsMqru gwvY rwjw Drmu duAwry ]
roman: gaaveh tuhano paun paanee baisa(n)tar gaavai raajaa dharam dhuaare ||
english: The praanic wind, water and fire sing; the Righteous Judge of Dharma sings at Your Door.

gurmukhi: gwvih icqu gupqu iliK jwxih iliK iliK Drmu vIcwry ]
roman: gaaveh chit gupat likh jaaneh likh likh dharam veechaare ||
english: Chitr and Gupt, the angels of the conscious and the subconscious who record actions, and the Righteous Judge of Dharma who judges this record sing.

gurmukhi: gwvih eIsru brmw dyvI sohin sdw svwry ]
roman: gaaveh ieesar baramaa dhevee sohan sadhaa savaare ||
english: Shiva, Brahma and the Goddess of Beauty, ever adorned, sing.

gurmukhi: gwvih ieMd iedwsix bYTy dyviqAw dir nwly ]
roman: gaaveh i(n)dh idhaasan baiThe dhevatiaa dhar naale ||
english: Indra, seated upon His Throne, sings with the deities at Your Door.

gurmukhi: gwvih isD smwDI AMdir gwvin swD ivcwry ]
roman: gaaveh sidh samaadhee a(n)dhar gaavan saadh vichaare ||
english: The Siddhas in Samaadhi sing; the Saadhus sing in contemplation.

gurmukhi: gwvin jqI sqI sMqoKI gwvih vIr krwry ]
roman: gaavan jatee satee sa(n)tokhee gaaveh veer karaare ||
english: The celibates, the fanatics, the peacefully accepting and the fearless warriors sing.

gurmukhi: gwvin pMifq pVin rKIsr jugu jugu vydw nwly ]
roman: gaavan pa(n)ddit paRan rakheesar jug jug vedhaa naale ||
english: The Pandits, the religious scholars who recite the Vedas, with the supreme sages of all the ages, sing.

gurmukhi: gwvih mohxIAw mnu mohin surgw mC pieAwly ]
roman: gaaveh mohaneeaa man mohan suragaa machh piaale ||
english: The Mohinis, the enchanting heavenly beauties who entice hearts in this world, in paradise, and in the underworld of the subconscious sing.

gurmukhi: gwvin rqn aupwey qyry ATsiT qIrQ nwly ]
roman: gaavan ratan upaae tere aThasaTh teerath naale ||
english: The celestial jewels created by You, and the sixty-eight holy places of pilgrimage sing.

gurmukhi: gwvih joD mhwbl sUrw gwvih KwxI cwry ]
roman: gaaveh jodh mahaabal sooraa gaaveh khaanee chaare ||
english: The brave and mighty warriors sing; the spiritual heroes and the four sources of creation sing.

gurmukhi: gwvih KMf mMfl vrBMfw kir kir rKy Dwry ]
roman: gaaveh kha(n)dd ma(n)ddal varabha(n)ddaa kar kar rakhe dhaare ||
english: The planets, solar systems and galaxies, created and arranged by Your Hand, sing.

gurmukhi: syeI quDuno gwvih jo quDu Bwvin rqy qyry Bgq rswly ]
roman: seiee tudhuno gaaveh jo tudh bhaavan rate tere bhagat rasaale ||
english: They alone sing, who are pleasing to Your Will. Your devotees are imbued with the Nectar of Your Essence.

gurmukhi: hoir kyqy gwvin sy mY iciq n Awvin nwnku ikAw vIcwry ]
roman: hor kete gaavan se mai chit na aavan naanak kiaa veechaare ||
english: So many others sing, they do not come to mind. O Nanak, how can I consider them all?

gurmukhi: soeI soeI sdw scu swihbu swcw swcI nweI ]
roman: soiee soiee sadhaa sach saahib saachaa saachee naiee ||
english: That True Lord is True, Forever True, and True is His Name.

gurmukhi: hY BI hosI jwie n jwsI rcnw ijin rcweI ]
roman: hai bhee hosee jai na jaasee rachanaa jin rachaiee ||
english: He is, and shall always be. He shall not depart, even when this Universe which He has created departs.

gurmukhi: rMgI rMgI BwqI kir kir ijnsI mwieAw ijin aupweI ]
roman: ra(n)gee ra(n)gee bhaatee kar kar jinasee maiaa jin upaiee ||
english: He created the world, with its various colors, species of beings, and the variety of Maya.

gurmukhi: kir kir vyKY kIqw Awpxw ijv iqs dI vifAweI ]
roman: kar kar vekhai keetaa aapanaa jiv tis dhee vaddiaaiee ||
english: Having created the creation, He watches over it Himself, by His Greatness.

gurmukhi: jo iqsu BwvY soeI krsI hukmu n krxw jweI ]
roman: jo tis bhaavai soiee karasee hukam na karanaa jaiee ||
english: He does whatever He pleases. No order can be issued to Him.

gurmukhi: so pwiqswhu swhw pwiqswihbu nwnk rhxu rjweI ]27]
roman: so paatisaahu saahaa paatisaahib naanak rahan rajaiee ||27||
english: He is the King, the King of kings, the Supreme Lord and Master of kings. Nanak remains subject to His Will. ||27||

gurmukhi: muMdw sMqoKu srmu pqu JolI iDAwn kI krih ibBUiq ]
roman: mu(n)dhaa sa(n)tokh saram pat jholee dhiaan kee kareh bibhoot ||
english: Make contentment your ear-rings, humility your begging bowl, and meditation the ashes you apply to your body.

gurmukhi: iKMQw kwlu kuAwrI kwieAw jugiq fMfw prqIiq ]
roman: khi(n)thaa kaal kuaaree kaiaa jugat dda(n)ddaa parateet ||
english: Let the remembrance of death be the patched coat you wear, let the purity of virginity be your way in the world, and let faith in the Lord be your walking stick.

gurmukhi: AweI pMQI sgl jmwqI min jIqY jgu jIqu ]
roman: aaiee pa(n)thee sagal jamaatee man jeetai jag jeet ||
english: See the brotherhood of all mankind as the highest order of Yogis; conquer your own mind, and conquer the world.
I bow to Him, I humbly bow.

gurmukhi: Awid AnIlu Anwid Anwhiq jugu jugu eyko vysu ]28]
roman: aadh aneel anaadh anaahat jug jug eko ves ||28||
english: The Primal One, the Pure Light, without beginning, without end. Throughout all the ages, He is One and the Same. ||28||

gurmukhi: Bugiq igAwnu dieAw BMfwrix Git Git vwjih nwd ]
roman: bhugat giaan dhiaa bha(n)ddaaran ghaT ghaT vaajeh naadh ||
english: Let spiritual wisdom be your food, and compassion your attendant. The Sound-current of the Naad vibrates in each and every heart.

gurmukhi: Awip nwQu nwQI sB jw kI iriD isiD Avrw swd ]
roman: aap naath naathee sabh jaa kee ridh sidh avaraa saadh ||
english: He Himself is the Supreme Master of all; wealth and miraculous spiritual powers, and all other external tastes and pleasures, are all like beads on a string.

gurmukhi: sMjogu ivjogu duie kwr clwvih lyKy Awvih Bwg ]
roman: sa(n)jog vijog dhui kaar chalaaveh lekhe aaveh bhaag ||
english: Union with Him, and separation from Him, come by His Will. We come to receive what is written in our destiny.
I bow to Him, I humbly bow.

gurmukhi: Awid AnIlu Anwid Anwhiq jugu jugu eyko vysu ]29]
roman: aadh aneel anaadh anaahat jug jug eko ves ||29||
english: The Primal One, the Pure Light, without beginning, without end. Throughout all the ages, He is One and the Same. ||29||

gurmukhi: eykw mweI jugiq ivAweI iqin cyly prvwxu ]
roman: ekaa maiee jugat viaaiee tin chele paravaan ||
english: The One Divine Mother conceived and gave birth to the three deities.

gurmukhi: ieku sMswrI ieku BMfwrI ieku lwey dIbwxu ]
roman: eik sa(n)saaree ik bha(n)ddaaree ik laae dheebaan ||
english: One, the Creator of the World; One, the Sustainer; and One, the Destroyer.

gurmukhi: ijv iqsu BwvY iqvY clwvY ijv hovY Purmwxu ]
roman: jiv tis bhaavai tivai chalaavai jiv hovai furamaan ||
english: He makes things happen according to the Pleasure of His Will. Such is His Celestial Order.

gurmukhi: Ehu vyKY Enw ndir n AwvY bhuqw eyhu ivfwxu ]
roman: oh vekhai onaa nadhar na aavai bahutaa eh viddaan ||
english: He watches over all, but none see Him. How wonderful this is!
I bow to Him, I humbly bow.

gurmukhi: Awid AnIlu Anwid Anwhiq jugu jugu eyko vysu ]30]
roman: aadh aneel anaadh anaahat jug jug eko ves ||30||
english: The Primal One, the Pure Light, without beginning, without end. Throughout all the ages, He is One and the Same. ||30||
On world after world are His Seats of Authority and His Storehouses.

gurmukhi: jo ikCu pwieAw su eykw vwr ]
roman: jo kichh paiaa su ekaa vaar ||
english: Whatever was put into them, was put there once and for all.
Having created the creation, the Creator Lord watches over it.
O Nanak, True is the Creation of the True Lord.
I bow to Him, I humbly bow.

gurmukhi: Awid AnIlu Anwid Anwhiq jugu jugu eyko vysu ]31]
roman: aadh aneel anaadh anaahat jug jug eko ves ||31||
english: The Primal One, the Pure Light, without beginning, without end. Throughout all the ages, He is One and the Same. ||31||

gurmukhi: iek dU jIBO lK hoih lK hovih lK vIs ]
roman: eik dhoo jeebhau lakh hoh lakh hoveh lakh vees ||
english: If I had 100,000 tongues, and these were then multiplied twenty times more, with each tongue,

gurmukhi: lKu lKu gyVw AwKIAih eyku nwmu jgdIs ]
roman: lakh lakh geRaa aakhe'eeh ek naam jagadhees ||
english: I would repeat, hundreds of thousands of times, the Name of the One, the Lord of the Universe.

gurmukhi: eyqu rwih piq pvVIAw cVIAY hoie iekIs ]
roman: et raeh pat pavaReeaa chaReeaai hoi ikees ||
english: Along this path to our Husband Lord, we climb the steps of the ladder, and come to merge with Him.

gurmukhi: suix glw Awkws kI kItw AweI rIs ]
roman: sun galaa aakaas kee keeTaa aaiee rees ||
english: Hearing of the etheric realms, even worms long to come back home.

gurmukhi: nwnk ndrI pweIAY kUVI kUVY TIs ]32]
roman: naanak nadharee paieeaai kooRee kooRai Thees ||32||
english: O Nanak, by His Grace He is obtained. False are the boastings of the false. ||32||
No power to speak, no power to keep silent.

gurmukhi: joru n mMgix dyix n joru ]
roman: jor na ma(n)gan dhen na jor ||
english: No power to beg, no power to give.

gurmukhi: joru n jIvix mrix nh joru ]
roman: jor na jeevan maran neh jor ||
english: No power to live, no power to die.

gurmukhi: joru n rwij mwil min soru ]
roman: jor na raaj maal man sor ||
english: No power to rule, with wealth and occult mental powers.
No power to gain intuitive understanding, spiritual wisdom and meditation.
No power to find the way to escape from the world.

gurmukhi: ijsu hiQ joru kir vyKY soie ]
roman: jis hath jor kar vekhai soi ||
english: He alone has the Power in His Hands. He watches over all.
O Nanak, no one is high or low. ||33||
Nights, days, weeks and seasons;
wind, water, fire and the nether regions

gurmukhi: iqsu ivic DrqI Qwip rKI Drm swl ]
roman: tis vich dharatee thaap rakhee dharam saal ||
english: in the midst of these, He established the earth as a home for Dharma.

gurmukhi: iqsu ivic jIA jugiq ky rMg ]
roman: tis vich jeea jugat ke ra(n)g ||
english: Upon it, He placed the various species of beings.
Their names are uncounted and endless.
By their deeds and their actions, they shall be judged.
God Himself is True, and True is His Court.
There, in perfect grace and ease, sit the self-elect, the self-realized Saints.
They receive the Mark of Grace from the Merciful Lord.
The ripe and the unripe, the good and the bad, shall there be judged.
O Nanak, when you go home, you will see this. ||34||
This is righteous living in the realm of Dharma.
And now we speak of the realm of spiritual wisdom.

gurmukhi: kyqy pvx pwxI vYsMqr kyqy kwn mhys ]
roman: kete pavan paanee vaisa(n)tar kete kaan mahes ||
english: So many winds, waters and fires; so many Krishnas and Shivas.

gurmukhi: kyqy brmy GwViq GVIAih rUp rMg ky vys ]
roman: kete barame ghaaRat ghaRe'eh roop ra(n)g ke ves ||
english: So many Brahmas, fashioning forms of great beauty, adorned and dressed in many colors.

gurmukhi: kyqIAw krm BUmI myr kyqy kyqy DU aupdys ]
roman: keteeaa karam bhoomee mer kete kete dhoo upadhes ||
english: So many worlds and lands for working out karma. So very many lessons to be learned!

gurmukhi: kyqy ieMd cMd sUr kyqy kyqy mMfl dys ]
roman: kete i(n)dh cha(n)dh soor kete kete ma(n)ddal dhes ||
english: So many Indras, so many moons and suns, so many worlds and lands.

gurmukhi: kyqy isD buD nwQ kyqy kyqy dyvI vys ]
roman: kete sidh budh naath kete kete dhevee ves ||
english: So many Siddhas and Buddhas, so many Yogic masters. So many goddesses of various kinds.

gurmukhi: kyqy dyv dwnv muin kyqy kyqy rqn smuMd ]
roman: kete dhev dhaanav mun kete kete ratan samu(n)dh ||
english: So many demi-gods and demons, so many silent sages. So many oceans of jewels.

gurmukhi: kyqIAw KwxI kyqIAw bwxI kyqy pwq nirMd ]
roman: keteeaa khaanee keteeaa baanee kete paat nari(n)dh ||
english: So many ways of life, so many languages. So many dynasties of rulers.

gurmukhi: kyqIAw surqI syvk kyqy nwnk AMqu n AMqu ]35]
roman: keteeaa suratee sevak kete naanak a(n)t na a(n)t ||35||
english: So many intuitive people, so many selfless servants. O Nanak, His limit has no limit! ||35||
In the realm of wisdom, spiritual wisdom reigns supreme.
The Sound-current of the Naad vibrates there, amidst the sounds and the sights of bliss.
In the realm of humility, the Word is Beauty.
Forms of incomparable beauty are fashioned there.

gurmukhi: qw kIAw glw kQIAw nw jwih ]
roman: taa keeaa galaa katheeaa naa jaeh ||
english: These things cannot be described.
One who tries to speak of these shall regret the attempt.

gurmukhi: iqQY GVIAY suriq miq min buiD ]
roman: tithai ghaReeaai surat mat man budh ||
english: The intuitive consciousness, intellect and understanding of the mind are shaped there.

gurmukhi: iqQY GVIAY surw isDw kI suiD ]36]
roman: tithai ghaReeaai suraa sidhaa kee sudh ||36||
english: The consciousness of the spiritual warriors and the Siddhas, the beings of spiritual perfection, are shaped there. ||36||
In the realm of karma, the Word is Power.
No one else dwells there,
except the warriors of great power, the spiritual heroes.
They are totally fulfilled, imbued with the Lord's Essence.
Myriads of Sitas are there, cool and calm in their majestic glory.

gurmukhi: qw ky rUp n kQny jwih ]
roman: taa ke roop na kathane jaeh ||
english: Their beauty cannot be described.

gurmukhi: nw Eih mrih n Twgy jwih ]
roman: naa oh mareh na Thaage jaeh ||
english: Neither death nor deception comes to those,

gurmukhi: ijn kY rwmu vsY mn mwih ]
roman: jin kai raam vasai man maeh ||
english: within whose minds the Lord abides.
The devotees of many worlds dwell there.
They celebrate; their minds are imbued with the True Lord.
In the realm of Truth, the Formless Lord abides.
Having created the creation, He watches over it. By His Glance of Grace, He bestows happiness.
There are planets, solar systems and galaxies.

gurmukhi: jy ko kQY q AMq n AMq ]
roman: je ko kathai ta a(n)t na a(n)t ||
english: If one speaks of them, there is no limit, no end.
There are worlds upon worlds of His Creation.

gurmukhi: ijv ijv hukmu iqvY iqv kwr ]
roman: jiv jiv hukam tivai tiv kaar ||
english: As He commands, so they exist.
He watches over all, and contemplating the creation, He rejoices.
O Nanak, to describe this is as hard as steel! ||37||
Let self-control be the furnace, and patience the goldsmith.
Let understanding be the anvil, and spiritual wisdom the tools.
With the Fear of God as the bellows, fan the flames of tapa, the body's inner heat.
In the crucible of love, melt the Nectar of the Name,
and mint the True Coin of the Shabad, the Word of God.

gurmukhi: ijn kau ndir krmu iqn kwr ]
roman: jin kau nadhar karam tin kaar ||
english: Such is the karma of those upon whom He has cast His Glance of Grace.
O Nanak, the Merciful Lord, by His Grace, uplifts and exalts them. ||38||
Shalok:

gurmukhi: pvxu gurU pwxI ipqw mwqw Driq mhqu ]
roman: pavan guroo paanee pitaa maataa dharat mahat ||
english: Air is the Guru, Water is the Father, and Earth is the Great Mother of all.

gurmukhi: idvsu rwiq duie dweI dwieAw KylY sgl jgqu ]
roman: dhivas raat dhui dhaiee dhaiaa khelai sagal jagat ||
english: Day and night are each like the nanny and her caregiving husband, in whose lap the whole world is at play.
Good deeds and bad deeds-the record is read out in the Presence of the Lord of Dharma.

gurmukhi: krmI Awpo AwpxI ky nyVY ky dUir ]
roman: karamee aapo aapanee ke neRai ke dhoor ||
english: According to their own actions, some are drawn closer, and some are driven farther away.

gurmukhi: ijnI nwmu iDAwieAw gey mskiq Gwil ]
roman: jinee naam dhiaaiaa ge masakat ghaal ||
english: Those who have meditated on the Naam, the Name of the Lord, and departed after having worked by the sweat of their brows

gurmukhi: nwnk qy muK aujly kyqI CutI nwil ]1]
roman: naanak te mukh ujale ketee chhuTee naal ||1||
english: -O Nanak, their faces are radiant in the Court of the Lord, and many are saved along with them! ||1||
